intro: Cynometra longipedicellata, commonly known as the African cherry or African rosewood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, round fruits containing several seeds. It is valued for its hard, dense wood used in furniture and musical instruments. The tree also has medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
